intro: Pentanema multicaule, commonly known as the clustered pentanema, is a flowering plant native to the southern Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and typically blue or purple flowers. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
